content.rendered:
Bhairavi is an advocate from India. She has worked with prominent Solicitors firm in Harrow and then shifted to academics teaching Law, Torts, Contract Act, Land Laws, English Legal Systems, Mathematics, Quantitative methods, Research Project, Business Decision Making, to Foundation Degree, first-year, second-year and Pre-master’s students. Have worked with various Universities ‘London South Bank University, Kingston University, Regent University’ 12 years of University lecturer experience with recent teaching at Regent University teaching ‘Analytical Tools and Techniques for Business’ (Statistics with Excel, STEM). She is a member of the BCA and Royal Statistical Society.

Key responsibilities

Higher Education Business Lecturer Teaching at Regent College /Buckinghamshire New University/ University of Bolton teaching Level 5 – Digital Business and New Technology’ and ‘Project Management,’ ‘Information System and Big Data Analysis’, and Finance

Research Interests and Publications

Special Research interest in Financial Technology ( Fintech), Machine Learning for Financial Modelling and Financial Mathematics. Bhairavi has completed PGCE Post-Compulsory Mathematics from IOE (UCL) and has made curriculum design for ‘Quantitative Research Methods for Research students’ centring postgraduate and doctorate research students, academic writing research paper on ‘Teaching Mathematics to adult learners, pedagogical innovation in STEM Education’ a case study.

Published ‘A Practitioner led Research, use of icebreaker as an effective tool to the enhancement of learners experience’.

“To enhance student engagement in continuing professional development in disciplines of Statistics, Operation Research, Quantitative Methods, Research Methods with pedagogy, incorporating research and the evaluation of professional practices.”
